intro: Micromeria imbricata var. rhodesiaca, commonly known as the Rhodesian micromeria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or yellowish flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitats.
